findings.details: N/A - CI/CD workflows don't process user input directly.
Secrets accessed via ${{ secrets.CODECOV_TOKEN }} and ${{ github.token }}. No hardcoded credentials.
N/A - No database operations in CI/CD workflows.
Workflows only run on push to main/master and PRs. Repository permissions control access.
GitHub Secrets are encrypted. No sensitive data in workflow files.

Workflow logs don't leak internal details. Bandit reports generated but not exposed publicly.
PR workflow includes security-scan job with Bandit and Safety checks.
Using default GITHUB_TOKEN with minimal permissions. No write permissions requested.
All actions pinned to major versions (v4, v5). Consider pinning to SHA for higher security.
PR title accessed via github.event context, not user-controlled command substitution.

recommendation: APPROVED - No security issues found. Secrets management follows best practices. Security scanning included in PR workflow.
